purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application resource for the representation of state.

The state_type_schema identifies a type of state by specifying the criterium that shall be satisified for something to be in a state of that type. For example, a state might be defined by the presence of an identified fault in a product.

The state_observed_schema identifies an observed state, which may be either predicted or actual, and enabling it to linked to the thing or things that are in the state. An observed state represents a period of time when the criterium defining the state type either are or will be satisfied for one or more items. Actual observed states therefore correspond to a period in the life of something. States are not limited to products but may apply to activities, people, and organizations.

inscope.li: definition of what is needed for a state to exist
relationship between two or more states
relationship between a state and the product, activity, people or organization that it affects

outscope.li: behaviour or history of product data capable of having state

fund_cons.p: A state represents the existence of something over a period of time when it exhibits some characteristic that can be identified and is distinct from other periods when that same characteristic does not apply. The characteristics define a type of state and are defined using data types specified in the state_type_schema.
States may be specified that are composed of multiple sub-states. They may be related by cause and effect when one state causes another.
